verses.text: But for thy holy ones there was great light; And \add the Egyptians, \add* hearing their voice but seeing not their form, Counted it a happy thing that they too had suffered,

Yet for that they do not hurt them \add now, \add* though wronged \add by them \add* before, they are thankful; And because they had been at variance \add with them, \add* they made supplication \add to them. \add*

Whereas thou didst provide \add for thy people \add* a burning pillar of fire, To be a guide for \add their \add* unknown journey, And withal a \f + \fr 18:3 \ft Gr. \fqa unharmful. \f* kindly sun for \add their \add* \f + \fr 18:3 \ft Or, \fqa aspiring \f* proud exile.

For well did \f + \fr 18:4 \ft Gr. \fqa they. \f* the Egyptians deserve to be deprived of light and imprisoned by darkness, They who had kept in close ward thy sons, Through whom the incorruptible light of the law was to be given to \f + \fr 18:4 \ft Or, \fqa future time \ft Gr. \fqa the age. \f* the race of men.

After they had taken counsel to slay the babes of the holy ones, And when a single child had been cast forth and saved \f + \fr 18:5 \ft Or, \fqa to be \ft to them \fqa a rebuke \f* to convict \add them of their sin, \add* Thou tookest away from them their multitude of children, And destroyedst all \add their host \add* together in a mighty flood.
Of that night were our fathers made aware beforehand, That, having sure knowledge, they might be cheered by the oaths which they had trusted:
\add So \add* by thy people was expected salvation of the righteous and destruction of the enemies;
For as thou didst take vengeance on the adversaries, \f + \fr 18:8 \ft Gr. \fqa By this. \f* By the same means, calling us unto thyself, thou didst glorify us.

For holy children \f + \fr 18:9 \ft Or, \fqa of blessing \ft Gr. \fqa of good \ft men, or, \fqa of good \ft things. \f* of good men offered sacrifice in secret, And with one consent they took upon themselves the covenant of the \f + \fr 18:9 \ft Gr. \fqa law of divineness. \f* divine law, That \f + \fr 18:9 \ft Some authorities read \fqa the saints would partake...perils; already leading the fathers’ songs of praise. \f* they would partake alike in the same good things and the same perils; The fathers already leading the sacred songs of praise.

But there sounded back in discord the cry of the enemies, \f + \fr 18:10 \ft Some authorities read \fqa And was piteously borne abroad in lamentation for children. \f* And a piteous voice of lamentation for children was borne abroad.
And servant along with master punished with a like just doom, And commoner suffering the same as king,

Yea, all \add the people \add* together, under one form of death, Had \add with them \add* corpses without number; For the living were not sufficient even to bury them, Since at a single \f + \fr 18:12 \ft Gr. \fqa turn of the scale. \f* stroke their \f + \fr 18:12 \ft Or, \fqa more cherished \f* nobler offspring was consumed.
For while they were disbelieving all things by reason of the enchantments, Upon the destruction of the firstborn they confessed the people to be God’s son.
For while peaceful silence enwrapped all things, And night in her own swiftness was in mid course,

Thine all-powerful word leaped from heaven out of \f + \fr 18:15 \ft Or, thy \f* \add the \add* royal \f + \fr 18:15 \ft Gr. \fqa thrones. \f* throne, A stern warrior, into the midst of the \f + \fr 18:15 \ft Or, \fqa destroying \f* doomed land,
Bearing as a sharp sword thine unfeigned commandment; And standing it filled all things with death; And while it touched the heaven it trode upon the earth.
Then forthwith apparitions in dreams terribly troubled them, And fears came upon them unlooked for.
And \add each, \add* one thrown here half dead, another there, Made manifest wherefore he was dying:
For the dreams, perturbing them, did foreshew this, That they might not perish without knowing why they were afflicted.
But it \f + \fr 18:20 \ft Gr. \fqa touched. \f* befell the righteous also to make trial of death, And a multitude were stricken in the wilderness: Howbeit the wrath endured not for long.

For a blameless man hasted to be their champion: Bringing the weapon of his own ministry, \add Even \add* prayer and the propitiation of incense, He withstood the indignation, and set an end to the calamity, Shewing that he was thy servant.

And he overcame the \f + \fr 18:22 \ft The word rendered \fqa anger \ft differs only by the transposition of two letters from the reading of the Greek text, which here yields no sense. \f* anger, Not by strength of body, not by efficacy of weapons; But \f + \fr 18:22 \ft Or, \fqa to a word did he subject \f* by word did he subdue \f + \fr 18:22 \ft Gr. \fqa him who was punishing.\f* the minister of punishment, By bringing to remembrance oaths and covenants made with the fathers.

For when the dead were already fallen in heaps one upon another, Standing between he stopped the \add advancing \add* wrath, And \f + \fr 18:23 \ft Gr. \fqa cleft asunder. \f* cut off the way to the living.

For upon \add his \add* long \add high-priestly \add* robe was the whole world, And the glories of the fathers \add were \add* upon the graving of the four rows of \f + \fr 18:24 \ft Gr. \fqa stone. \f* precious stones, And thy majesty \add was \add* upon the diadem of his head.
To these the destroyer gave place, and these \f + \fr 18:25 \ft Some authorities read \fqa he feared. \f* \add the people \add* feared; For it was enough only to make trial of the wrath.
